name: Hot Mess
description: First attempt at using a Dinosaurus and Dagger in an Exile deck. For more discussion see my blog post here: http://daman-asha.livejournal.com/29597.html

name: Jackson's Magnificent Engine v1.1
description:
JME minimises the number of agenda in the deck thanks to TWiY*'s minimum deck size allowing 18 agenda points in a 40-44 card deck. Six 3-point Agenda makes for a hard search for the Runner in R&D (~13.6%) and only one in a full HQ means a small chance (~16.7%) for any one access to hit the Agenda card.

For more detailed discussion see my blog post: http://daman-asha.livejournal.com/29597.html

name: Weyland Ice Advanced V1.2
description: I have throw the cards using tags, cause i wasn't using tags ! My bad, i was surely tired. I put in more econom cards, different project and some ice.

name: Riena Runs Cheap (looking for feedback)
description: cheap runs and credit denial, get up fast and hit hard before the corp can afford to rez ice

name: HB: Off the Grid
description: HB deck utilizing drip economy and minelayer to build a strong HQ. Amazon allows you to rez for -3 when minelayer triggers saving even more money. TMI is strong and if you install and rez during a run your opponent has to decide to burn money on the trace or let it rez. A variety of Bioroid ice to punish the runner, porous ICE on R&D (Ichi, sherlock) and EtR ICE on HQ and archives. Low cost of ICE and amazon makes E shutdown less painful. Minelayer also makes acct syphon weaker since you can install and rez during the run and lower your money. You're poor but hopefully the runner still is too.

name: HB: Off the Grid v1.1
description: I forgot to replace priority req with project Wotan in previous build.

name: Noise Anarch 1.0 RAK: Suggestions please?
description: I'm pretty certain I need to trim ten cards out of this thing, but I'm in the position of liking pretty much all of them. It's a problem.

name: NBN Tag and burn: Suggestions please!
description: I'm looking for some suggestions for this basic NBN deck I've put together. It's gotten me a few wins over the past week of trying it out but I feel like it could be a bit better. Any suggestions?

name: Break Their Spirit (Feedback Welcome)
description: lots of passive economy. Slow the runner down with awful ice on centrals and pile up things to  stop them on a single remote. First  replicating perfection deck so i  am interested in feedback

name: Break Their Spirit 1.1 (Feedback Welcome)
description: put in shadows to put on the outside of centrals and advance.

name: Chaos Research & Destroy
description: Le future deck gagnant du régional de Toulouse

name: Quiet Riot (Feedback)
description: Install cheaply and cycle viruses in order to mill. Feedback appreciated.

name: The Experiential Jazz Professor v3
description:
The 3rd version of my jenky Professor deck that incorporates suggestions from HepatitvsJ, like going with the second Datasucker instead of Stimhack and Armitage instead of Freelance Coding for economy.  I've been playtesting this for the last week or so and think it runs pretty well... for a jenky Professor deck at any rate.

Djinn is obviously an early target of SMC or even Test Run, so I have included more viruses for it to tutor. I don't love Darwin, but it will get you through a Rototurret or Chimera for 4 and 2 creds right out of the box and you won't cry if it gets taken out by a Swordsman. Note that Djinn has 3 MU for any non-icebreaker programs, not just viruses, so it can be a good spot for SMC or Sneakdoor.

Another tip is that, despite the fact that you really want a Test Run/Scavenge to combo out your Morning Star or Femme, don't be afraid to Test Run for a breaker if you aren't drawing SMC.

I don't like having only 1 Plascrete based on the amount of Tag and Bag I see in my meta, so I am looking for a card to cut or perhaps just running 46.

Suggestions for improvements are welcome.

name: Parasital Nightmare v4
description:
Current Version of my deck built around recurring parasites. It is a single Core build and I really like it. Wyrm+Parasite kill everything (and you do have the money to finance Wyrm) and the Corp gets into trouble to install new ICE and rezzing it. If he doesn't: Great, an unprotected R&D, release the Mediums!

This deck works out really well. Femme breaks Sentries, Corroder gets those cheap Barriers teared down and other ICE is destroyed by Wyrm. That Wyrm is the most important ICE breaker and you really want to draw it rather early.

The small amount of ICE breakers and Hardware (overall 10 cards) leaves plenty of room for plenty of economy cards. You usually have a lot of money and can afford running and running and running.

Give this deck a try, it is fun to play and I yield a high winning percentage with it :)

name: PE Tag & Bag
description: Nice steady drip damage from single point agendas, traps and SE to finish runners off.

name: Hechigenio
description: pre-Reina Deck. This deck works best with a lot of installing. Looking to include Wyldside and Aesops for future iterations. Might just go with Clone Chip/Diesels to return some Caissas and help with the drawing.
